trans-unit.source: Provides design-time support in a visual designer for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.MultiView"></xref> Web server control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MultiView> control is a container for a group of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.View> controls.
An application renders a specific <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.View> control to the client browser based on criteria that the application defines.

In a visual designer, when you switch from Source to Design view, the markup source code that describes the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MultiView> control is parsed and a design-time version of the control is created on the design surface.
When you switch back to Source view, the design-time control is persisted to the markup source code and edited into the markup for the Web page.
The MultiViewDesigner class provides design-time support for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MultiView> control in a visual designer.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MultiViewDesigner"></xref> class.

The .NET Framework internally constructs a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MultiViewDesigner> class when it creates the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MultiView> control or a copy of that control on the design surface.
Gets a value that indicates that the <xref uid="langword_csharp_nowrap" name="nowrap" href=""></xref> HTML attribute should not be used.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> in all cases.
